full_summary:
**Title:** AAFC Laboratory Facilities Maintenance Audit, St-Hyacinthe, Quebec

**Solicitation Number:** EP922-230501/A

**Tender Closing Date:** September 20, 2022, 16:00:00 (local time)

**Trade Agreement:** Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding

**Procurement Category:** Services

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal

**Selection Criteria:** Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price

**Contracting Entity:** Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)

**Location:** Quebec (except NCR)

**End-User Entity:** Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC)

**Point of Contact:** Alexandre Tikhonovitch

* Email: [alex.tikhonovitch@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca](mailto:alex.tikhonovitch@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca)
* Phone: (780) 901-7940
* Fax: (418) 566-6167

**Document Content:**

Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites proposals from qualified proponents to provide professional services for a comprehensive Facilities Maintenance Audit for the Saint Hyacinthe Food Research and Development Centre (FRDC) located in Saint Hyacinthe, Quebec.

**Scope of Work:**

The successful proponent must be a Mechanical/Maintenance/Reliability Specialist with a minimum of 15 years of asset management, maintenance, and reliability experience in a commercial, industrial, educational, or laboratory setting. Certification CMRP (Certified Maintenance & Reliability Professional) or equivalent is required. Fluency in both French and English is essential.

** Bid Submission:**

Bid documents are available electronically through the GETS service provider on the Government of Canada website at http://buyandsell.gc.ca/procurement-data/tenders. Firms must submit their bid in English or French. Bidders are encouraged to use the epost Connect service provided by Canada Post Corporation for electronic bid transmission.

**Notice:**

Due to the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, bid submissions will be accepted by mail or electronically. Please note that due to limited staff, the bid-receiving unit in Edmonton will maintain limited hours of operation (Monday and Thursday, 9:00 am to 11:00 am, and Tuesday, 9:00 am to 2:00 pm local time). Changes to bid closing dates may occur;
